word[0]: have half a mind to do something
definition[0]: used to say that you would like to do something but you probably will not do it
example[0]: He had half a mind to ask for his money back.
example[1]: I have half a mind to tell your mother about this.
definition[1]: used to say that you might do something to show that you disapprove of something someone has done
example[2]: I’ve a good mind to tell him exactly what I think.
example[3]: I’ve half a mind to stop him seeing her altogether.
definition[2]: used to say that you may decide to do something
example[4]: I’ve half a mind to come with you tomorrow.
